headers.subject: PINGING QUESTION
headers.received: (from mail@localhost) by int-mx1.corp.redhat.com (8.11.6/8.11.6) id i0Q5s6O14239 for redhat-list@listman.back-rdu.redhat.com; Mon, 26 Jan 2004 00:54:06 -0500
headers.list-id: General Red Hat Linux discussion list <redhat-list.redhat.com>

body.para: Dear Users I have been managing a small network for quite some time . I have configured two VLANs , one for server side and another client side. Server side IPs could be (say) 101.102.2.1 t0 101.102.2.10 and client side IPs could be 192.168.2.1 to 192.168.2.100( just an example). two Vlans could be routed through IP 101.102.2.21. Our ISP router IP is (say) 222.122.99.65.
But What I want to know is that when i log on as a normal user and ping my ISP router its fine but as a root response time is very high. Is this my server problem? Or some script is running behind ?
